Blog.post: Well, I've just finished my 9 hour shift, and quite frankly, It was... GREAT! Today had to be my best day at work yet! I finally got to use the Truck to wheel around the millions of trolleys that awaited me on the carpark of lurve, I made one little crash at the beginning and then for the rest of the day, I was error free and flying around with a bazillion trolleys attached to a battery powered toaster on wheels. I made 2 new friends today who are probally the coolest guys on the trolleys - Mark and John. Mark is 19 and John is oldish with grey hair and a moustachio. Today I finally got to use some teamwork that years of internet gaming had taught me so well to collect the trolleys and we kept on top of the work load all day by clearing out bay at a time all together. It was fantastic! And then me and mark got sent on an adventure around the world to collect a trolley that a person had complained about being outside his house (Most likely that he pushed it to his house with all his shopping and couldnt be bothered to bring it back himself as it was about a mile or so away) For anyone who lives near me, It was down on St. James road near the wellington pub. I got to have a good talk to Mark and we laughed at how everyone should be called Mr. Miyagi and we both wished we had his healing hands. Yeap, that's right, I've figured out how to add imaged to my posts! Prepare to face many more of them in the future. John was right about the heatwave, it was sooo sunny and hot today, I was nearly melting into the carpark tarmac! When I got home, I looked in the mirror and I think ive got slightly sunburnt cheecks! Which means I now have rosy red cheecks and feel quite stupid I didnt actually wear any suncream. A text of clare defeated the heatwave we had here in Liverpool though because it was 34 degrees over where she was, so I shouldn't really complain about it being hot, actually bring on my nice weather! The more the merrier I am! I got to enjoy my an hour and a half long break today, but instead of having it all in one go, I split it up into 3 half hour chunks, for the first two I came home, and one time my family were watching the School of Rock which my sister had rented out, It's such a good film! And its also the movie me and clare went to see were we had our first sober kiss! *sings* Because you're not hardcore... Unless you live hardcore!!! and the legend of the rent was way HARDCORE! Tomorrow dawns a new month, the lovely summer month of august! What will it have in store for me? Hopefully lots of parties, having friends around for drinks, cocktail sausages (a la clares house) all this will only be possible if my family go off on holiday again! Which im 99% sure they will, if they dont I will scream and be forced to smash stuff... Please email me suggestions of things I can smash to - urlLink jaybones@gmail.com

Well, Today is the 30th July and that means its Clare's birthday! *dances* I got RUDELY woken up by a text off clare saying that she had just rang my house but my brother didnt wake me up to speak to my girlfriend who I really miss (grr) but she loves my present (wahoooo!) and it made her friend cry!!! (In a good way of course). Before I carry on, I don't know why I'm putting so many brackets in this post but it's lots of fun I can tell you that (It suuuure is!) I texted her back saying ring again, and I prodded my brother for not waking me, and when she rang I screamed at her HAPPY BIRTHDAYYYY! and apparently she was having a really good day, and she liked the present and her friend organised a special surprise party for her, which wasn't so much a surprise because some lady couldn't keep her mouth shut, but apparently the party was really good! I only got to speak to her for 7 minutes on the phone, but when she gets back from France, she'll have to spend several hours talking to me about all the adventures she had in France along with the many many photographs :D I'm going to buy her tickets to see urlLink Hell Is For Heroes live the day after she gets back from holidays as a little "Welcome back to the best country in the world!" (Ha!) kind of thing. Of course I'm going to buy myself a ticket too! Not only is it Clare's birthday but its also my first day off! *boogies* yay! But seeing as I cant get enough of Tescos, I ended up going down there looking for a Computer game with John (Counterstrike - Condition Zero) so that I can get the CS: Source Beta when It's released but he had already bought the last copy in the store, so thankfully I saved myself 20 smackers there really! I got to enjoy my big day off by playing lots of computer games, watching TV, sleeping, watching DVDs and generally being a slob and I quite enjoyed doing nothing for once this summer. The worse thing about a day off is that you know that soon enough you will be back at work/college/whatever doing the same thing yet again but I tend not to think about that side of it... because tomorrow I am working my first full shift (9 hours - Midday till 9pm) and it's gonna be a killer, according to John, it is going to be a heatwave and a half, so I best get my shades and suncream because hopefully tomorrow is going to be a scorcher!

That's right folks, I had a crappy day at work! I was just in such a gloomy mood and the time just dragged on and on. Firstly it was REALLY sunny until 2 minutes after I got outside my house on the way to work (I was actually running 2 minutes late too) when all of a sudden it just decides to rain, and rain and rain a bit more! 6 hours pushing trolleys in the rain, I know its something I'll have to get used to but it was sunny allllllll day upto when I started work! Arrrgh. But that's not all. I was making loads of mistakes because loads of stupid customers were around, bugging me and leaving trolleys all over the place, I got mixed up and put loads of trolleys in the wrong place and people LAUGHED AT ME! I wasn't impressed to say the least, I grumbled and got back on to work, and remember how I said I was looking forward to using the magic trucks today? Well with my luck, one bloke had lost the keys earlier the same day, so there was only one truck available, but that was in use by this 60 year old man - Mally who spends most of his shift laughing at my expense! That's not all of my bad day at work, because of all this laughter and rain and mistakes I kept on crashing the trolleys into ballards and I really hurt my stomach, shins, toes, hands, fingers, thumbs and groin, all on seperate occasions!!! I bruised my thumb nail and made it crack nearly in half and it bled and I was like owwwwwwwwwwwyyyyyyyyyyyyy my thumb!!! And I had to go see a first aider and they were like GORDON BENNET! Look at that! Ewww! which didnt really make me feel much better but theres not much I can do about that now. I got a plaster on it, which was ok but it wasnt a colourful plaster with little cartoon people on it, so that made my day at tescos even worse, but thankfully 11 arrived and my new friend Chris the Security guard was leaving that night only to get a job in the Home and Bargain warehouse, easy come easy go I suppose! I was so glad to get home though, I just sat down and loaded up a nice game of Worms Armageddon (which I'm addicted to now) It's clare's birthday tomorrow and shes in france a good few hundred miles away from me, I really wish I could be there to celebrate it with her, but we dont get what we want sometimes unfortunatly! I just text her wishing her a happy birthday (It's after midnight there in france) all I can hope is that she has a great day with all her friends there in lourdes!

I've finished my training on the trucks (Quickarts to ordinary non-trolley folk) and I can forsee my job becoming much much easier! With these trucks, I get to push around nearly 20 trolleys in one go, without having to push them one bit, just press a button and steer! Nothing better! I can't wait for tomorrow when I get to fully try it out, to go along with my super training completion, it was really sunny and hot, and it was a fine day for SCIENCE! *ahem* and trolley dollying as well of course! In the 3 days I've been there, I've already made a couple of mates who seem pretty swish! But I've noticed that most of my trolley co-workers are extremely bitchy (sounds awfully similar to Clare's Health and Beauty Dept. Workers at Over-priced Sainsburys) When one guy isnt around, all I hear is bad stuff theyve done, and no doubt theyll end up talking about me, but I dont care, I'll just get along with my job and enjoy the paychecks every 4 weeks! I forgot to mention, today I saw my first shoplifter umm.. shoplifting! He ran out the door, only to be chased by 3 beefed up security guards and several managers, he dived across the bonnets of a few cars and jumped on top of a few roofs to get away, but thankfully they caught him, and used extreme force!!! They threw him on the ground and dived on him! It was better than sitting through an Arnold Schwarzenegger movie marathon! The funny thing was is that the shoplifting nutter was not stealing anything too valuable like a digital camera, batteries, or DVDs but he decided to try and steal a few packets of bacon and a steak. What a guy I think now he'll be sitting in some prison regretting he wasnt a vegetarian. Apart from that, my day has been pretty much uneventful, apart from the and several televisions exploding in Tescos and being punched on the way home... Nah only messing =) Day Seven is near, Will I survive another day at work? Who knows, watch this space...

My second day at work is over and my feet are still just as sore as they were yesterday, but I'm not complaining because I have a super duper cool job! It's loads of fun, and because I worked the night shift, the place was empty and I got to stand around and talk to my new friend Chris about random crap for 2 hours with pay! Wahey! Tomorrow is my final day of "Training" as it were, which really should of been over within 15 minutes of me starting because there's not much to learn about pushing trolleys around but nevermind, and after tomorrow, I get to use the magic Trucks to push my trolleys around! Ohhh my job is going to get 30x more easier! I can't wait! After working from 5pm till 11pm, I arrived home at 12:40am. How? Ohh because I got some supplies in of course, and talking to Chris for about half an hour after work, poor Bonny was sitting by the front door with her legs crossed dying to go for a walk when I arrived back home aww poor doggy. Want to know what I got on my shopping trip? No? Tough luck, I got some skimmed milk because im now being much more healthy (Ive managed to lose half a stone in the last few months just by cutting back on crappy foods a bit, and ive become much less spottier which Im VERY pleased about), some lucozade, mini scotch pancakes for breakfast (yum), and some chewies for when im working tomorrow. Hopefully soon, I'm going to buy some music playing device (MD player probally) and take that to work with me to help me get by those lonely, lonely days. It's actually 2:13am at the moment and I'm still here typing up my bloggy, I should really get to sleep because I'm at work at 10 for 6 hours and im going to end up curling up in a trolley and going to sleep. So for now, I think ill end this and make a bigger post tomorrow with some more rambleing about nothing in particular... I miss clare =(

Well, after moaning earlier this morning about the rain and starting my new job, It wasn't as bad I first imagined! Yes, It was raining a bit, but I managed to get hold of a spare illuminous yellow jacket and I managed to blind a total of 7 people today, which is a new world record for jacket related blindnesseseseseseseses. I got there and my Work "buddy" - Jimmy - didn't have a clue that I was starting or even existed so he was a bit surprised and ranted for about an hour about how he never gets told anything nowdays, but hes a boss fella and he helped show me the ropes, or the trolleys as it were. *bdum tsh* I get to use a little "truck" which is just a little radio controlled electric powered box on wheels that helps you push around several thousand trolleys in one go, its soooo much fun, surprisingly I was actually enjoying my job, UNTIL (oh yes, you knew this was coming) one of the managers asked me politely to scrape up all bits of grass and weeds that were growing in the cracks of the flagstones outside!!! Apparently it's under the job description (Ha, No it ain't) but another manager (Jill - She was my interviewer too) said you're best off doing it, but you can get asked to do all sorts of crazy crap, but dont worry about it. Jill is the cool manager who gave me some over-time hours on my first day! Wahooo! Pushing around trolleys for a bit with a super electronic truck at my disposal was fun but the scraping the grass (only for half an hour mind you) just extracted the michael in my opinion. Jimmy and I had to go into the warehouse to try and find some scraper thing that the cleaners use to scrape chewing gum off the floor outside, but alas, no scrapey thingymabob was in sight, so we used our initiative (20 points to us) by getting a mop handle without the mop, and a wallpaper stripper dolally and celotaped them together to form our own scraper majig! Woosh! One of the best parts about my day at Tescos was that I got called with Jimmy to go into prescot town centre and collect the stray trolleys that had gone walkies, we went up to somerfield and stole back a few trolleys and walked around for a bit which was a nice change of scenery (I say this and I've only worked there a day) Apparently theyve been called out as far as Rainhill or Huyton Village to retrieve trolleys (and thats a long distance for a trolley to go missing) and I'm looking forward to a day when I get called out to go walking for a couple of hours with pay! I get to my only half hour break, and as I'm about to enter the staff restaurant (which is Hella cheap) we get called out to the back where a new delivery of trollies had just arrived, 35 baby carrier doodars and we were like OoOOoOooO bugger off, we're going for our break! So after a nice lunch and a cup of tea, we go back and find out that we're going to need the Truck, and the truck is ALLLLLL the way around the front of the shop, so we cut through the store, but to get back with the truck, we have to leave the car park, go down a main road and down another road just to get to the back of the store! And it takes about 5 minutes to walk it without a truck or a load of trollies, so as you can tell, that took up the rest of my day! By this time, my feet felt like they had been powersanded into a coffee table. Finally 4 o' clock arrives and I get to come off duty and go home! Hoorar... or do I? NO! I decided that I should get some shopping in seeing as my family is away and we have no milk or bread or BBQ sauce! It came to a total of £5.23! How good is that!!!!! And I bought lots of stuff too, I'm so proud of tescos! *dances* I got some skimmed milk too because I felt like a change and I want to get rid of my tummy, soooo why not go for the healthier, less fatty, still as yummy skimmed option? It's all good! Enough of work in this rant, let me move on to this evening, I done 3 loads of washing, done some ironing and the dishes, all in preparation of the movie I was going to watch! The name of that movie? "I am Sam" I have seen it before, but it is probally my favourite film ever, they story line is great and it's so moving, I managed to tape it, but I want it on DVD! Maybe there will be extras! Maybe. The only problem is, well not a problem but a very small annoyance is that the film doesn't have a definitive ending, I know that alot of films do, and its not like a cliffhanger ending, but just a "Guess what happened next?" kind of ending, It's kind of obvious but there are still a few loose ends and it makes me scream out for more! Maybe it's just because I dont want the film to end, Every minute, every second I enjoy it and If you havent already loaded up amazon.co.uk to order your copy, DO IT NOW! You wont be disappointed! Hopefully Clare hasn't seen it yet and we can spend an quiet evening together watching it and go through about 70 different emotions together in just under 2 hours. Speaking of clare, she rang me today! All the way from apparently super sunny and really warm Lourdes, France. Picking up the phone to hear her again just made so happy, I didnt realise how much I miss her already, [getting soppy now] but it was so thoughtful of her to ring me and even though we only spoke for about 3 minutes, It was the best 3 minutes of my day! It's her birthday this coming Friday and she has taken a my present with her, I really wish I could be there with her when she opened it, but i'm sure she'll enjoy it, I spent hours taking photos of lots of places we have been together, and searching all across liverpool for a suitable scrapbook to stick the photos in, the easiest part about it was buying a Pritt Stick to glue the photos to the page, but finally after walking around Liverpool for about 6 hours I think it was, I finally managed to finish taking photos (all the photos are just from liverpool =P) Blood, Sweat and Sugar, sorry Tears went into making it and all I hope now is that she'll enjoy it as much as I did creating it! But before worrying about if she'll enjoy my present, I have to worry about my poor feet tomorrow as Im working from 5 till 11 pm (6 hours =P) pushing trollies around, I'll end up with no feet by friend, pushing myself around in a modified trolly. Day 5 approaches...

Its 9:30am at the moment and I start work in 30 minutes! Argh!!! The worse thing is that it's just started to rain and seeing as I'm a trolly dolly, I'll be outdoors all day, without my uniform, meaning I'll have no warm fleece, no waterproof coat, no safety shoes! *sob* Hopefully no one will come shopping ever whilst I'm on duty and I wont have to get any trollies, that or just no-one that I know, so that they can point and laugh and chuckle and fall over in hysterics at my new job =( I just can't handle it!

What can be better than google? Google Email or Gmail of course! Just when everyone was starting to fall in love with google (I've been a die hard google user for years) they bring out their amazing email system! It's fantastic webmail, with spam filters, conversational emails (hard to explain) but shame for those who haven't got one as it's only in its beta testing stage at the moment! The only thing is that I never get any emails in my gmail (Ohh I can Rhyme) and thats what I love most about having an email account, actually getting emails! Today with all different Instant Messaging programs such as MSN, ICQ, AOL, Yahoo! etc, I think people are forgetting all about how great emails actually are! It's worse with the Royal mail, with so many people just using the internet to send letters to friends and family, the only post we get are either bank statements or random crap spam mail from the likes of Mecca Bingo. Everyone feels special when they recieve something which isnt spam or bank statements in the post, and its the same when I get a decent email to read! Its a shame I never get more, Maybe Its because I dont have any friends? NEVER! I do have friends (I think ¬_¬) but no one sends emails nowadays! Having said that, I do get emails fairly often from my girlfriend, and on the rare occasion I get an email or two from my friend Mike, but apart from that, the rest are just annoying forwards where by I'll either day by being run over by a bus in the next 3 hours or I will never fall in love and live alone with my pet rock called cliff if I dont pass it on to 60 people or more within the next 2 minutes. Gah! Forwards are the bane of my life, but back to Gmail and Email! I try to encourage people to email me, but no one ever does, If anyone is reading this email me! Make me feel loved! =( I'm going to try get everyone on my MSN Messenger list to start sending emails, like it or not, and hopefully get my gmail account active with emails flying everywhere! Come to think about it, I might even start sending hand written letters to people soon! Spread the love! Anyone who might be reading this, send an email to a friend of yours and make them feel special! And whilst you're at it, send me one too =) *wink* Gmail how I love thee! Its just a shame that emails are too few and far between nowadays! Let's start a revoltion people! Get email-ing! My Email Address - urlLink jaybones@gmail.com Just incase you were wondering ;)

Well, what can I say? It's been a long day today, it went from bad to good to even better... allow me to explain. Sunday - Recognised through-out the world as a day of rest, so what does your honourable Jaybones do? He has no time for rest, he fights on! He does all the clothes washing, he does the ironing, he watches a movie, HE HAS A BATH! Yay! No longer is he the smelly daemon he once was! But let me get back to that... Let me start with this morning - The bad part of the day. I woke up and to my surprise, I couldnt talk to myself, not like I do, ever... No I dont! ARGH *ahem* but yes I couldn't talk, I couldn't laugh, I couldn't sing, I couldn't LOVE! and also I couldn't swallow, that's right folks, my head had been decapitated by the Prescot Ripper, No seriously, I had the worse sore throat of my life. As you could guess I was not in the best of moods when I woke up then, so after taking the dog for a walk after it tried to scratch my eyes out from excitement (My dog gets hyperactive whenever you pick up a set of keys and tries to jump on top of your head) Where was I? Oh yea, Having just taken the dog out, I stumble down to Tescos (with my keys this time thankfully) and I found some Strepsils Extra (Pain Relief ones) when all of a sudden, Disaster Struck! *horror music* Some grossly overweight, mega obese, scarily ugly 13 year old girl in a shockingly short mini-mini-mini skirt PURPOSELY bumped into me, just to piss me off. I was a bit annoyed but I ignored it, carrying on looking around, I find myself drooling over some loaves of bread when the same girl is walking towards me, and I ignore her presence when she walks behind me, she elbows me on purpose! Grrrrrrr so by now I was fuming... so I walked around the shop a bit more to get away from this psycho biatch then she comes at me again in some other isle, so i turn around and try to scream at her "FUCK OFF WHORE" but it ended up sounding like a hamster being squeezed, sort of like this "FucJFheuiheurher GrrHrlgrlg" I just couldnt talk and I just kind of whimpered, found her mother and whispered what she was doing to me, and she shouted at her infront of everyone, Score one for Jaybones! After this my day started getting better, after some lozengers my throat felt much better, I done all the ironing and washing, but saying that I have some new washing to do! Oops! After all this, I sat down and enjoyed watching Orange County on TV, Id recommend it to anyone who hasnt seen it yet! I was going to tape it for the "other half" but I missed the first 15 minutes of it because I was playing "boy games" (Worms Armageddon as a matter of fact) and then the moment of glory arrived.. I started to run my first bath in about 4 years! I think the whole world cheered for no longer would they have to put up with my grotesque smell! You've probally guessed that I always get showers instead because theyre much more quicker and less water consuming ("Save the planet" I always say) Whilst the water was running, I made myself a big mug of coffee and put on some music, then once in the bath, it was one of the most relaxing things ever! I'm going to get a bath more often! (Sorry world!) And that leads me to now, just gone past midnight once more as I've just entered the realms of Day Four... What will tomorrow (today *prod*) bring? Who knows but what I do know is that I start work for the first time today at 10am and finish 6 hours later at 4pm, pushing trollies around all day, there's going to be plenty of fun to be had, I just hope that crazy girl shows up so I can ram 30 trollies into her kneecaps! Grrrr...

Let me start off by saying WAHOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO! I was woken up several times this morning by my family coming in and out of my room, but I finally got out of bed at 11 to bid farewell to my family (and sister!) as they departed for the South of Wales! Yay! As soon as the door closed behind them, I just started to dance around the house shouting and screaming because I was FREEEEEEEE! Yes, WAS... 10 minutes later, my Dad bursts through the doors looking for a spare light bulb for the brake lights in the car! Jeeze, that ruined the moment of freedom but nevermind! I had to get ready for my new Job (Trolly Dolly =P) so I dived in the shower and went down there all dressed up in my fancy white shirt and pants, I get there to be welcomed by 10 other people for their Induction to the job, each person had a different position to me so I felt a bit left out, most were in the Café! But what struck me was how EVERYONE was wearing their own clothes, I felt a bit stupid showing up like that, but nevermind, No harm done! 4 hours of watching videos, joining the Workers Union, sorting out uniform needed and ordering it (I get the most uniform because I work with the trollies! I get super water proof pants, safety shoes, a Tescos Fleece and a glow in the dark blind-everyone-in-a-53-mile-radius jacket and some more pants and shirts all because I rule! I even found out my lovely working hours, I work for a total of 19 hours a week but I'll be doing lots of over-time during the summer holidays whilst its not too gloomy outside with British weather kicking in any time soon! Without the over-time I get a nice total of £81.32 a week which aint bad at all in my opinion! Take £1.50 from that for being in the union and I get just under 80 smackers which again is still not too bad at all! and when I go back to college, I'll be getting EMA payments each which which are a total of £30, which I can't complain with one bit, Getting paid to go to college, nothing better! So in total that brings me up to £111.32 a week! Not bad going if you ask me! That's $204 or €167 or 22,403 Yen wahoooo! If only it was 22,403 pound a week, Id be super rich! If only I was super clever too, I managed to lock myself out of my house today, and with no family in for a week, that's not always a good thing! I was just taking my doggy (bonny) for a walk and shut the door when I realised I didn't bring my keys out with me! I quite literally screamed and said a few naughty words which I won't discuss here, thankfully my Nan has a spare set of keys incase I do anything stupid like that so I plod over to her house with the doggy and i'm saved! Apparently she was going to be leaving 5 minutes after I got the keys for a few hours so I had some good luck there! I did my first clothes wash today, I put my shirt in the washing machine and turned it on, BIG ACHIEVEMENT I know, but it's the first time I've ever washed clothes, and I have to do it all by self this week 'cause I'm a big boy now! But what's even better is, I did lots of ironing whilst that shirt was in the wash! I ironed a few of my shirts and some other bits and bobs that my family left on the washing lines! I was so proud of myself, Of course, It's impossible to do ironing if you're not watching Spongebob Squarepants! That makes ironing SO MUCH more fun! (No, Seriously It does!) Day Two without the missus ordering me around or without one of my best mates hasnt been to bad because I've kept myself ocupied but I got a text of her saying how good the swimming pool is there and now I wish I was with her swimming :( Even though she wouldnt ever let me see her in a swimming costume :/ One last thing before I leave, Today at "work", I wore a pair of shoes which were a size too small for me, I didn't realise until I got there and my toes were REALLY hurting, so I basically took the shoes off and killed everybody in the room with the foul smell of my feet! It was fun! I didnt realise how painful smaller shoes can be after 4 hours of torture! Anyways, It's hit midnight again and I must prepare myself for the spooky Day Three when another of my best friends returns from his holidays! Many games of counter-strike await me! Yay! Hasta Luego...

Hi there and welcome to my blog! My name is Jay Leather and I should already know that seeing as I’m talking (writing) to myself! Where do I start with these things? Well I’m just going to ramble and if anyone actually reads this *waves* hello to you! And if anyone actually reads this and doesn’t fall asleep, then email me because you’ve won a prize! *claps* I thought I’d create this blog to just let me ramble about everything going on, because as of today, my lovely girlfriend Clare, has gone on holiday for two weeks to the sunny south of France! So I’m girlfriendless in Seattle for two weeks, which might seem bad enough, but it gets worse! One of my best friends – Mike – has gone to Tukey today as well for two weeks also! Argh! I’m all alone, there’s no one here beside me! (Name the movie!) but it doesn’t end there, tomorrow, My family are all going on holiday for a week! Yay! I got quite scared this morning though, after being woken up by a text message from Clare whilst she was on the coach, my mum tells me that the family are going on holiday tomorrow! That kind of shocked me into a state of woken-upness! But not everything went my way, it turns out that my sister (Jessica) was going to stay here with me too! ARGHHHHHHHHHH If my sister were to stay, all we would do is argue, fight, and throw plates at each other leading to a gun fight, a few lightsabers, then a civil war, leading to world war and of course the end of the world, all because my sister stayed at home, so I had thought all this through, and explained to her in terms that she could understand, (“You’re not staying here! You can get lost!”) and so she is going with Mum, Dad and my brother to the also sunny – South of Wales. =) I start work tomorrow, and it’s the first job that I’ve ever had! I'm quite scared about it all but I'm sure I’ll be fine! Does anyone want to take a guess at what my job title is? No guesses? Nobody? I guess I shouldn’t really expect a response seeing as I'm talking (typing) to my self! But I'm a Trolly Dolly for the glorious Tescos Supermarket! Don’t you laugh at me, it’s mean! All hail the mighty shopping trolly/cart!!! Its only been a day since my girlfriend has gone, but I do miss her already, I went to her house yesterday with my new digital camera and took some pictures of her so I don’t forget what she looks like whilst she’s away for all those years… well, 2 weeks! It’s just gone past midnight and I now enter the gloomy shadows of Day 2...

Bad Boys, Bad Boys! *ahem* Sorry, Tonight I watched the awesome Bad Boys II starring non other than Will Smith and Martin Lawrence! I might as well the rest of the day first! I had to force myself out of bed at 11AM! That's seriously messed up for a holiday, generally I'm never awake to see the morning but today was an exception because I was going to Liverpool with the infamous Holly Miller! I haven't seen her since her party-thingymabobba over a month ago back at the beginning of the holidays! I met her on the train and we just talked and chatted and nattered and jibber-jabbered for ages about everything and when we arrived in Liverpool, we went to the Albert dock because she wanted to go look around the Tate Gallery! Before we got in there however, I had the biggest shock of my life, the island they used for Fred the Weatherman's reports from "This Morning" has gone! They've removed it! I almost felt like crying, I sometimes went there as a kid to watch him give the weather and scream "OoOoOOOooOh" Everytime he jumped across from england to ireland! Anyways, We finally entered the gallery after me moaning and crying for several minutes and to be honest, It was a lot better than I expected!
